badges.text:
You can only eat items made entirely out of fuel items. Torches and scaffolding are exempt as food items, as are tools like fishing rods and bows.
Fuel does not restore food unless you are not at full hunger. Fuel is always restored if you are missing any.
You can not interact with the world while holding a food item unless you sneak.
> Wooden items, paper, leaves, flowers, saplings, wool = Melon. Restores 1 fuel.
> Coal, charcoal, blaze powder, gunpowder, campfires = Cooked chicken. Restores 10 fuel.
> Coal block, blaze rod = Golden carrot. Restores 60 fuel.

name: Manufacture Munitions
description:
While grounded, you produce 4 munitions per second. Munitions are used by your active abilities.
§f§nObsolete Armaments§r
Your melee damage dealt is reduced by 75%.
§f§nOld Jet Engine§r
Your maximum health is reduced by 20%. In addition, you are equipped with self-propelled wings, which produce their own thrust as long as you have fuel. You will plummet down if you run out of fuel mid-flight.
§f§nFuel Conversion§r
You can not eat normal food. Instead, you must consume items you can burn and gain fuel from. The amount of food/saturation and fuel you get depends on the item consumed. Sneaking prevents you from eating.
§f§nCredit Where It’s Due§r
Enemies killed with your special armaments do not drop experience.
§f§nDevastation of War§r
Your special armaments can destroy items, making it harder for you to loot anything.
§f§nSlow Repairs§r
You regain health 66% more slowly.
§f§nLanding Strip§r
You gain a speed bonus when sprinting on rails.
§f§nPowder Keg§r
If you take explosive or fire damage while your munitions are over halfway full, you will explode, dealing damage to yourself and other creatures around you. You can prevent this explosion if you get in water until your ammunition stabilizes or by drinking any potion or bottle of water.
